Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To deliver, through excellent leadership and engagement with CPS staff and partners in the Criminal Justice System, the highest quality, most efficient and effective prosecution service within their Area, across all legal advice, legal decisions, advocacy, business and staff management.  To promote CPS’ core values and the equality and diversity agenda, ensuring there are effective internal and external communications strategies in place.  They will work collaboratively and collegiately in their Area to deliver improvements in local and the wider Area performance, ensuring consistent and clear high quality representation of CPS across the wide range of the Area’s responsibilities and relationships.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Plays a key role in maximising efficiencies across the CPS on both casework and support service issues; is directly accountable to the Director of Public Prosecutions for the quality of legal decisions and for the delivery of performance and business outcomes. Within the context of the CPS strategic objectives, they are accountable for setting business direction, priorities and coordinating all the Areas within their remit to ensure that performance against all targets is met. Responsible for the Area Complex Casework Unit and direct management responsibility for the Area Business Manager, Deputy Chief Crown Prosecutors/Deputy Heads of Division within their Area/Division.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: This role covers a range of core functions from complex casework to policy to people management.  The job holder will work in partnership with a wide range of experts to achieve CPS’ goals.  They influence the CPS business model,  and are adept at communicating it to internal and external audiences and .  They provide assurance to the CPS Board on the achievement of the highest standards of internal controls and public sector governance. They .  They are able to develop team capability in line with the business plan and organisational vision and  and to manage change effectively, identifying resistance, building engagement,  and involvement, and recognising and rewarding innovation. R They take responsibleility for the successful delivery of programme benefits  through cost effective measurement processes and oversee the development and delivery of viable business cases.

Name: Baljit Ubhey
Job Title: Director of Prosecution Policy and Inclusion
Job/Team Function: The Director of Prosecution Policy and Inclusion will lead on equality and inclusion across the service helping the CPS to strengthen the focus on community engagement as well as supporting high quality casework through their policy and guidance framework.

Name: Alison Saunders
Job/Team Function: The Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) is the national head of service for the Crown Prosecution Service for England and Wales, appointed by and responsible to the Attorney General.  It is the function of the DPP with a view to initiation or continuation of criminal proceedings, to consider the facts and information brought to their notice by police or others, and where they think proper, to initiate, undertake and carry on criminal proceedings.

Name: Nick Folland
Job/Team Function: The Chief Executive Officer (CEO) reports to the Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) and acts as the second Accounting Officer for the Crown Prosecution Service (CPS). Working in close partnership with the DPP, they are responsible for ensuring the day-to-day delivery of business.  They provide the leadership and direction required to develop the CPS’ vision, the delivery of its’ priorities, objectives and the Service’s strategic and business plans. The CEO leads  and  manages  the  executive  team,  ensuring high standards of resource management - both people and financial - corporate governance and risk management.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: This role covers a range of core functions from complex casework to policy to people management.  The job holder will work in partnership with a wide range of experts to achieve CPS’ goals. Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Internal Assurance Advisor Role is integral in sustaining the CPS’ ability to assure the impact of new initiatives and improving the quality of service delivery.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Director's Strategic Policy and Accountability Advisor reports directly to the DPP providing advice and assistance on the most complex, sensitive and high profile casework and assurance on legal standards across the CPS.  This includes provision of strategic direction, setting case strategies, dealing with complex disclosure matters, media handling and trial strategies, working with and directing the reviewing prosecutor/Counsel.  As the Head of Profession for the organisation (besides the DPP) they also lead a group of CPS advocates and conduct certain appellate advocacy on behalf of the service.
